name: Tears To Tiara: Kakan no Daichi
name_original: Tears To Tiara: Kakan no Daichi
description:
Tears to Tiara (ティアーズ・トゥ・ティアラ Teiazu tou Teiara) is a Japanese adult tactical role-playing game developed by Leaf. It was first released for Windows on April 28, 2005 in Japan. A PS3 version, titled Tears to Tiara: Kakan no Daichi, was released in July 2008 with additional content, a complete overhaul to the graphics and the adult material removed.

The game draws heavily from Welsh, Celt, Christian and Roman mythology, with characters named Arawn, Rhiannon, Arthur, Epona, Pwyll, Ller and Taliesin.Set in a Late Antiquity-inspired fantasy setting, story starts on an island Erin (or Hibernia, as shown on an in-game map) on the west border of the Holy Empire.Prologue is centered around the precognition-gifted priestess of the Gael tribe, Rhiannon. She is kidnapped by a rogue priest of the Holy Empire, Drwc, to be used as a sacrifice in a ritual meant to resurrect the Demon King Arawn and put Drwc in his favor. As a response the Gael people burn their village and swear to bring Rhiannon back or exact revenge on the Empire.
